titles: Eben Ezer, as a thankefull remembrance of Gods great goodnesse unto the city of Bristoll in preserving them from the forces of Prince Rupert without, and a treacherous plot within, to betray the city to them the seventh day of March 1642. / T.P. dedicates this.
author: T. P.
Philipot, Thomas, d. 1682, attributed name.
notes: Verse - "O thou who dost excell the highest praise,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
Bristol (England) --  History --  Siege, 1643 --  Early works to 1800.
